intro: Cyphostemma molle, commonly known as the soft cyphostemma, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Cyphostemma molle is often found in rocky or wooded areas and is adapted to dry and semi-arid environments.
